revisions.rev:
{{Notability|date=September 2011}} '''Startkey''' is a [[USB|USB flash storage device]] developed by [[Microsoft]] and [[SanDisk]].
==History== StartKey began in May 2007 when [[Microsoft]] and [[Sandisk]] made an agreement to provide unspecified software to replace [[U3]] that was included on SanDisk flash devices.<ref>[http://www.everythingusb.com/microsoft-startkey-14376.html{{Dead link|date=August 2011}} Microsoft StartKey, Replacement for U3?] Everything USB, March 5th 2008</ref> <ref>[http://www.u3-info.com/sandisk/microsoft_and_sandisk_still_working_on_startkey_the_new_u3_replacement Microsoft and SanDisk still working on StartKey - the new U3 replacement] U3-info, March 7 2008</ref> <ref>[http://blogs.zdnet.com/microsoft/?p=1232 Microsoft preps StartKey: A 'Windows companion' on a USB stick] ZDNet, March 2 2008</ref>
==Features== StartKey will turn [[USB]]-based flash drives into a â[[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] companionâ that will allow users to carry their [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[Windows Live]] settings with them. It will work with other formats, including [[Secure Digital|SD memory cards]].
==See also== *[[Windows To Go]] *[[Portable application]] *[[Portable application creators]] *[[Comparison of application launchers]]
